official-title.#text:
To amend part D of title IV of the Social Security Act to
		  prohibit States from charging child support recipients for the collection of
		  child support.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Elimination of Single Parent Tax Act
			 of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 454(6)(B)(ii)
			 of the Social Security Act

header.#text:
Prohibition on
			 States from charging child support recipients for the collection of child
			 support

quote.#text:
retained by the State from support collected on behalf of the individual
			 (but not from the first $500 so collected), paid by the individual applying for
			 the services,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 457(a)(4)
			 of the Social Security Act

quote.#text: that remains after withholding any fee pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, each amendment made by this Act shall take effect
			 on October 1, 2013, and shall apply to payments under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elimination of Single Parent Tax Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: for quarters beginning on or after such date.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
part D of title IV of the
			 Social Security Act

header.#text:
Delay permitted
			 if state legislation required

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, a qualified State plan shall not be regarded as
			 failing to comply with
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elimination of Single Parent Tax Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, solely by
			 reason of the plan failing to comply with the additional requirements imposed
			 by reason of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part D of title IV of the Social Security Act

text.#text:
The date described in this paragraph is the first day of
			 the first calendar quarter that begins after the close of the first regular
			 session of the State legislature that ends after the effective date of this
			 Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, in the case of a State
			 that has a 2-year legislative session, each year of the session is deemed to be
			 a separate regular session of the State legislature.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elimination of Single Parent Tax Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b/p:2/sp:A
Elimination of Single Parent Tax Act of 2013/s:4/ss:b/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
part D of title IV of the Social Security
			 Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines will require
			 State legislation (other than legislation appropriating funds) in order for the
			 plan to meet the additional requirements imposed by reason of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

term.#tail: means a State plan, approved under
